page.title: 09The Primitive Methodists
page.content: Mr Joseph Bourne,the father of Hugh, was a farmer at Ford Hays Farm in the Parish of Stoke upon Trent.He had a fondness for strong drink,which was a beset-ment to him through a protracted life.Hugh's mother was habituated to the Church Of England made of worship, consequently she became strongly attacked and devoted to the religous practices and duties of the religion of her fathers. Bourne had been aware of the Methodists as a sect, that John Wesley had formed within the Church of England.One Sunday night in Macclesfield he watched the Methdodists going to chapel and was impressed. He became a Methodist but people didn't like his type of Methodism. He changed to become a Primiive Methodist. This is like the revivalist type of church.
